basedOn.display: MRI Whole Body MSK W/WO Contrast Prot

valueString:
RESULT: 


MRI OF THE HEAD, NECK, CHEST, ABDOMEN, PELVIS AND LOWER EXTREMITIES.


INDICATION:  Schwannomatosis.


TECHNIQUE:  MRI was performed on a 3-Tesla system using multiplanar 3-D 
anatomical and fluid sensitive sequences.  Contrast material was  
administered. 8.5 cc of gadavist.


COMPARISON:  Whole body MRI from 11/29/12.


FINDINGS:


NERVES:


There is diffuse enlargement of the cervical nerve roots at the C2 level 
and below bilaterally. The neural foramina throughout the cervical spine 
are expanded due to nerve root enlargement. There is a dominant 1.7 x 6.1 
cm mass originating from the left C4 nerve root. There is a dominant 2.6 
x 1.4 cm mass arising from the right C5 nerve root, both seen on series 
6, slice 63. Numerous smaller masses are seen in the cervical nerve roots 
extending into the roots of the brachial plexus, compatible with this 
patient's history of schwannomatosis. The lesion have minimal 
heterogenous enhancement. The ADC map demonstrates marked artifactual 
distortion in the head and neck.


The T1 nerve roots are enlarged bilaterally measuring 2.3 cm in maximal 
dimensions, unchanged since last examination. The T2 nerve roots are 
enlarged bilaterally, the right T2 nerve root measures 3.8 cm in maximal 
axial dimension, unchanged. The left T2 nerve root measures 2.0 cm in 
maximal dimension. The T3 nerve roots are also enlarged bilaterally, 
similar to prior examination. The left T3 nerve root measures 1.8 cm in 
maximal dimension, the right measures 1.4 cm. The T4 nerve roots are 
minimally prominent bilaterally.


1.2 cm T2 hyperintense lesion in the subcarinal region, series 8, slice 
189, with a target sign suggesting a nerve sheath tumor. Alternatively 
this may represent a lymph node.


ALIGNMENT:  Anatomic


FLUID:   Minimally increased fluid in the iliopsoas bursa bilaterally.


JOINTS:  Intact


MUSCLES:  No denervation changes. Mild left trochanteric bursitis. 
Moderate left greater than right hamstring tendinopathy.


TENDONS:  Intact.


LIGAMENTS:  Intact


BONES:  Unremarkable.


VASCULAR:  Patent cervical and mediastinal and visualized abdominal 
vasculature.


MASSES:


In the soft tissues at the left posterior occiput there is a 4.5 x 1.3 cm 
T2 bright lesion there is heterogenous postcontrast enhancement.


In the left retromaxillary trigone there is 2.2 x 1.2 cm T2 hyperintense 
lesion without associated post contrast enhancement. Similar appearing 
1.3 x 1.5 cm T2 hyperintense lesion within the alveolar ridge of the left 
maxilla without enhancement.


8mm T2 hyperintense lesion in the posterior aspect of the left parotid 
gland, possibly a lymph node.


There is a 2.1 x 1.3 cm mass centered in the left aryepiglottic fold 
series 8, slice 127 with T2 hyperintensity and central enhancement.


No suspicious thoracic or abdominal masses.


OTHER:


1.1 cm mucous retention cyst or polyp in the floor of the left maxillary 
sinus antrum. Mild diffuse sinus mucosal thickening.


Minimal atelectasis is present within the lung bases.


Small bilateral hydroceles. Mild bladder wall thickening with prominent 
trabeculations.
